intro: Ouratea dewevrei, commonly known as the white-flowered ouratea, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Annonaceae and is characterized by its showy, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a glossy appearance. The fruit is a berry that contains several seeds, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
